command.name: rib-in
command.abstract: show the routes received by one BGP router

description.p: This command shows the routes received from the selected peers of one router, i.e. the content of the Adj-RIB-Ins of this router. The command takes two parameters to filter the output. The first parameter filters the peers whose Adj-RIB-Ins are shown. The parameter can be an IP address or a wildcard (*). The second parameter can be an IP address, an IP prefix or a wildcard (*). If it is an IP address, best-matching is done. If it is an IP prefix, exact-matching is done. Otherwise, the routes towards all destinations are shown.

Output format:
<flags> <prefix> <peer> <pref> <metric> <AS-Path> <origin>
(see bgp router show ribbgp_router_show_rib for more information on the fields).
